attributes.action: Revoke ”The Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany” 1990”
attributes.background: In 1990 UK government signed a treaty letting Germany off from it's WW2 wartime debts of approximately £3.6 trillion. It is only fair that Germany pay their share as the aggressor.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament cannot unilaterally revoke a multilateral treaty.
